Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky brown with very faint traces of added white bands near bottom of foot; edge of foot reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 367 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot. For parallels regarding Simple Animal Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Histria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1123) (phase 2)
